H0.text: Activation energy is required to get started by exothermic reactions, like all chemical reactions.

H1.text: Surface energy is what exothermic reactions, like all chemical reactions, require to get started.

H2.text: Membrane energy is required to get started for exothermic reactions, like all chemical reactions.

H3.text: Specific energy is required to get exothermic reactions started, just as all chemical reactions require it.

A4.text: Activation energy is the minimum energy barrier that reactant molecules must overcome to transform into products.

A5.text: A reaction occurs only if enough molecules have kinetic energy equal to or greater than this barrier, which usually requires sufficiently high temperature.
